words.englishSentence: There is one ball on the table.

words.sentence: Apat na mangga ang nasa basket.
words.englishSentence: There are four mangoes in the basket.
There are five books on the table.

words.sentence: Anim na itlog ang nasa plato.
words.englishSentence: There are six eggs on the plate.
There are seven chairs in the room.
There are eight birds in the tree.

words.sentence: Siyam na halaman ang nasa hardin.
words.englishSentence: There are nine plants in the garden.
There are ten people in the class.
There are eleven flowers in the vase.
There are twelve fruits in the basket.

words.sentence: May bente na tao sa parke.
words.englishSentence: There are twenty people in the park.

words.sentence: May isang daan na mga libro.
May isang libo na mga piso.
May limang libo na mga piso.

pages.text: Ang Tatlong Baboy
pages.englishText: Three Little Pigs

pages.text: May tatlong baboy. Sila ay gumawa ng mga bahay.
pages.englishText: There are three pigs. They made houses.

pages.text: Ang unang baboy ay gumawa ng bahay ng dayami.
pages.englishText: The first pig made a house of straw.

pages.text: Ang ikalawang baboy ay gumawa ng bahay ng kahoy.
pages.englishText: The second pig made a house of wood.

pages.text: Ang ikatlong baboy ay gumawa ng bahay ng bato.
pages.englishText: The third pig made a house of bricks.

pages.text: Dumating ang lobo. Sabi niya, 'Papasok ako!'
pages.englishText: The wolf came. He said, 'I will come in!'

pages.text: Sabi ng unang baboy, 'Hindi!' Hinipan ng lobo ang bahay. Nasira ito!
pages.englishText: The first pig said, 'No!' The wolf blew the house. It broke!

pages.text: Sabi ng ikalawang baboy, 'Hindi!' Hinipan ng lobo ang bahay. Nasira rin ito!
pages.englishText: The second pig said, 'No!' The wolf blew the house. It broke too!

pages.text: Sabi ng ikatlong baboy, 'Hindi!' Hinipan ng lobo ang bahay, pero malakas ito.
pages.englishText: The third pig said, 'No!' The wolf blew the house, but it was strong.

pages.text: Ang lobo ay umalis. Ang mga baboy ay ligtas.
pages.englishText: The wolf left. The pigs were safe.

pages.text: Masaya ang mga baboy. Sila ay nagluto ng hapunan.
pages.englishText: The pigs were happy. They cooked dinner.

pages.text: Nag-imbita sila ng mga kaibigan. Sila ay kumain ng adobo at suman.
pages.englishText: They invited their friends. They ate adobo and suman.

pages.text: Ang tatlong baboy ay kumanta at nagsaya buong gabi.
pages.englishText: The three pigs sang and celebrated all night.

questions.text: What material did the first pig use for his house?
What material did the second pig use for his house?
Did the wolf blow down the first pig's house?
Did the wolf blow down the second pig's house?
What did the pigs cook for dinner?
Who did the pigs invite for dinner?
How did the pigs celebrate after dinner?

stories.title: Kayumanggi Caribou, Anong Nakikita Mo?
stories.english-title: Brown Caribou, What Do You See?
stories.author: Doktor Filip

pages.text: Kayumanggi Caribou, Anong Nakikita Mo?
pages.englishText: Brown Caribou, What Do You See?

pages.text: Kayumanggi caribou, kayumanggi caribou, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Brown caribou, brown caribou, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang pulang ibon, pulang ibon, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a red bird, red bird, what do you see?

pages.text: Pulang ibon, pulang ibon, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Red bird, red bird, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang berdeng palaka, berdeng palaka, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a green frog, green frog, what do you see?

pages.text: Berdeng palaka, berdeng palaka, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Green frog, green frog, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang dilaw na pusa, dilaw na pusa, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a yellow cat, yellow cat, what do you see?

pages.text: Dilaw na pusa, dilaw na pusa, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Yellow cat, yellow cat, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang asul na isda, asul na isda, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a blue fish, blue fish, what do you see?

pages.text: Asul na isda, asul na isda, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Blue fish, blue fish, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang puting kuneho, puting kuneho, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a white rabbit, white rabbit, what do you see?

pages.text: Puting kuneho, puting kuneho, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: White rabbit, white rabbit, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang isang turkesang isda, turkesang isda, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: I see a turquoise fish, turquoise fish, what do you see?

pages.text: Turkesa, turkesa, anong nakikita mo?
pages.englishText: Turquoise fish, turquoise fish, what do you see?

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang pulang ibon, berdeng palaka, at dilaw na pusa.
pages.englishText: I see a red bird, green frog, and yellow cat.

pages.text: Nakikita ko ang asul na isda, puting kuneho, at kayumanggi caribou.
pages.englishText: I see a blue fish, white rabbit, and brown caribou.

pages.text: At ako! Lahat tayo ay magkaibigan! Lahat tayo ay masaya!
pages.englishText: And me! We are all friends! We are happy!

questions.text: True or False: The animals saw each other.
True or False: The caribou was alone.

pages.text: Ang Pagong at ang Kuneho
pages.englishText: The Tortoise and the Hare

pages.text: Isang araw, nagyayabang ang isang kuneho tungkol sa kaniyang bilis.
pages.englishText: One day, a hare was boasting about his speed.

pages.text: ‘Walang makakatalo sa akin sa pagtakbo,’ sabi ng kuneho.
pages.englishText: ‘No one can beat me in a race,’ said the hare.

pages.text: Ang pagong ay naglakad patungo sa kuneho. ‘Gusto kong subukan,’ sabi ng pagong.
pages.englishText: The tortoise walked up to the hare. ‘I’d like to try,’ said the tortoise.

pages.text: Ang kuneho ay tumawa nang malakas. ‘Ikaw? Masyado kang mabagal!’
pages.englishText: The hare laughed loudly. ‘You? You’re too slow!’

pages.text: Ngunit ang pagong ay nagpumilit. ‘Subukan natin at tingnan kung sino ang mananalo.’
pages.englishText: But the tortoise insisted. ‘Let’s race and see who wins.’

pages.text: Sa araw ng karera, nagsama-sama ang mga hayop upang manood.
pages.englishText: On the day of the race, the animals gathered to watch.

pages.text: Sumigaw ang soro, ‘Handa na kayo? Takbo!’
pages.englishText: The fox shouted, ‘Are you ready? Go!’

pages.text: Agad na umalis ang kuneho at mabilis na tumakbo.
pages.englishText: The hare took off immediately, running fast.

pages.text: Habang tumatakbo, napaisip ang kuneho, ‘Masyadong mabagal ang pagong. Kaya ko pang magpahinga.’
pages.englishText: While running, the hare thought, ‘The tortoise is so slow. I can take a nap.’

pages.text: Humiga ang kuneho sa ilalim ng puno at natulog.
pages.englishText: The hare lay down under a tree and fell asleep.

pages.text: Samantala, patuloy na naglakad nang dahan-dahan ang pagong.
pages.englishText: Meanwhile, the tortoise kept walking slowly but steadily.

pages.text: Hindi tumigil ang pagong, kahit na siya ay mabagal.
pages.englishText: The tortoise never stopped, even though he was slow.

pages.text: Sa wakas, nakarating ang pagong malapit sa finish line.
pages.englishText: Finally, the tortoise reached near the finish line.

pages.text: Nagising ang kuneho at nakita na ang pagong ay malapit nang manalo.
pages.englishText: The hare woke up and saw that the tortoise was about to win.

pages.text: Agad tumakbo ang kuneho, ngunit huli na siya.
pages.englishText: The hare ran as fast as he could, but it was too late.

pages.text: Ang pagong ay nakatawid sa finish line at nanalo.
pages.englishText: The tortoise crossed the finish line and won.

pages.text: Ang lahat ng hayop ay nagdiwang para sa pagong.
pages.englishText: All the animals cheered for the tortoise.

pages.text: ‘Paano mo iyon nagawa?’ tanong ng kuneho.
pages.englishText: ‘How did you do it?’ asked the hare.

pages.text: Ngumiti ang pagong. ‘Dahan-dahan ngunit tuloy-tuloy ang panalo.’
pages.englishText: The tortoise smiled. ‘Slow and steady wins the race.’

pages.text: At iyon ang aral ng alamat: ang pagtitiyaga ay nagdadala ng tagumpay.
pages.englishText: And that is the lesson of the story: perseverance brings success.

questions.text: Who was boasting about their speed?
Who wanted to race the hare?
Who shouted 'Ready? Go!'? (‘Handa na kayo? Takbo!’)
What did the hare do during the race?
True or False: The tortoise stopped to rest during the race.
What was the lesson of the story?
